trans-unit.source: Describes the width, height, and location of an integer rectangle.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or ``` ## XAML Values *X* The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
*Y* <xref:System.Int32?displayProperty=fullName> The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
*Width* <xref:System.Int32?displayProperty=fullName> The width of the rectangle.
*Height* <xref:System.Int32?displayProperty=fullName> The height of the rectangle.
## XAML Text Usage You can also use whitespace instead of commas to delimit values.
Whitespace can also be used with a comma delimited value set.

Initializes a new instance of an <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*> and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*> coordinates and the specified <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*> and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> instance which specifies the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> instance which specifies the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> instance which specifies the width of the rectangle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> instance which specifies the height of the rectangle.
Gets the empty rectangle, a special value that represents a rectangle with no position or area.
This property is the same as calling the constructor using 0 for all parameter values.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *property* A property that accepts a value.
An empty rectangle with no position or area.
Determines whether the specified rectangle is equal to this rectangle.
This operation tests for object equality.
The object to compare to the current rectangle.

**true** if *o* is an <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> and the same <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*> as this rectangle; otherwise, **false**.
Determines whether the specified rectangle is equal to this rectangle.
This operation tests for object equality.
The rectangle to compare to the current rectangle.

**true** if both rectangles have the same <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*> as this rectangle; otherwise, **false**.
Determines whether the specified rectangles are equal.
This operation tests for object equality.
The first rectangle to compare.
The second rectangle to compare.

**true** if *int32Rect1* and *int32Rect2* have the same <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*>; otherwise, **false**.

Creates a hash code from this rectangle's <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*> values.
This rectangle's hash code.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*> and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*> properties of the <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> are greater than 0.
true if the and properties of the are greater than 0; otherwise, false.
Gets or sets the height of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.
The default value is `0`.
Gets a value indicating whether the rectangle is empty.
**true** if the rectangle is empty; otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **true**.
Compares two rectangles for exact equality.
The first rectangle to compare.
The second rectangle to compare.

**true** if *int32Rect1* and *int32Rect2* have the same <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*>; otherwise, **false**.
Compares two rectangles for inequality.
The first rectangle to compare.
The second rectangle to compare.

**false** if *int32Rect1* and *int32Rect2* have the same <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*>; otherwise, if all of these values are the same, then **true**.
Creates an <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> structure from the specified <xref:System.String> representation.
A string representation of an <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref>.
The equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> structure.
Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect> instance is cast to an <xref:System.IFormattable> interface.
The format to use.
The provider to use to format the value
The value of the current instance in the specified format.
Creates a string representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref>.

A string containing the same <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*> values of this <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> structure.
Creates a string representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref> based on the supplied <xref:System.IFormatProvider>.
The format provider to use.
If provider is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current culture is used.
A string representation of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect"></xref>.
Gets or sets the width of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The default value is `0`.
Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The default value is `0`.
Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The default value is `0`.
